_header: O wavering World all wrapped in wretchidness
Note: Perhaps by Hawes, but not by Skelton
_description: Elegy on the death of Henry VII, A.D. 1509 — seven 8-line stanzas

DurArchReg4.First Lines:
O wauering Worlde all wrapped in wretchidnesWhat auales thy pompes
                    so gay and gloryous…
DurArchReg4.Last Lines:
…Creses in Richesse Iulius in gloryHenry the vijth
                    ingraued here lyeth dede
DurArchReg4.Note:
On deposit in Durham, University Library, Archives and Special
                    Collections.
